quote_a: In my personal life, this would be more logo or tattoo ideas that I have, or just different graphics and work. It could be related to PowerPoint or creating slideshows and decks.
quote_b: I was trying to create an idea for a tattoo that I wanted to get, and I kept asking it to change the style of the image to replicate another style more. I even included reference images, but it just wasn't able to recreate it in the way I was hoping.
explanation: She describes using AI regularly for logo and tattoo ideas, yet recounts a clear failure at exactly that task where AI could not meet her needs despite multiple attempts with reference images.

quote_a: I don't think the experience is much different than a survey necessarily. I personally prefer not to do video or oral interviews. A written survey would be more preferable to me, I think.
quote_b: I'm looking for a hands-off dictation type situation where I can think aloud. I want to be able to say, "Oh, create this list," and then I can tell everything I want on the list, and it can formulate it itself. Or, "I want to make this grocery list. Can you organize it by category?" or "Add this to my calendar. Remind me of this thing that's coming up," that kind of stuff.
explanation: She explicitly prefers written communication over oral interaction, yet her ideal AI experience centres on speaking aloud and hands-off voice dictation.
